trans-unit.source: DMS Setup

seg-source.mrk: DMS Setup

trans-unit.source: Basic setup is performed in the DMS Setup page, accessed from the navigation pane by clicking Departments > cc|dms > Setup > DMS Setup.

seg-source.mrk: Basic setup is performed in the DMS Setup page, accessed from the navigation pane by clicking Departments > cc|dms > Setup > DMS Setup.

trans-unit.source: : DMS Setup

seg-source.mrk: : DMS Setup

trans-unit.source: When the DMS Setup page is opened for the first time, the setup initializes itself. The setup contains all important global configuration for cc|dms.

seg-source.mrk: When the DMS Setup page is opened for the first time, the setup initializes itself.
The setup contains all important global configuration for cc|dms.

trans-unit.source: General FastTab

seg-source.mrk: General FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on the General FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the General FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Doc. Library Nos.

seg-source.mrk: Doc.
Library Nos.

trans-unit.source: Displays the number series used to create new document libraries. The number series should allow manual numbering.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the number series used to create new document libraries.
The number series should allow manual numbering.

trans-unit.source: Upload Type

seg-source.mrk: Upload Type

trans-unit.source: Defines how to upload documents. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Defines how to upload documents.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Client – Documents will immediately be uploaded in the current Microsoft Dynamics NAV user’s context after defining the MetaData.

seg-source.mrk: Client – Documents will immediately be uploaded in the current Microsoft Dynamics NAV user’s context after defining the MetaData.

trans-unit.source: Queue – After defining the MetaData, all documents will be copied into a Queue (Document Entry), which must be processed by a Navision Application Server (NAS) or a user manually. The upload will use the NAS’ user context.

seg-source.mrk: Queue – After defining the MetaData, all documents will be copied into a Queue (Document Entry), which must be processed by a Navision Application Server (NAS) or a user manually.
The upload will use the NAS’ user context.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Document Actions.htm#_Ref425177975" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Document Actions” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Document Actions.htm#_Ref425177975" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Document Actions” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: SharePoint File Duplicate

seg-source.mrk: SharePoint File Duplicate

trans-unit.source: Determines how duplicate file names will be handled in the target document library. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Determines how duplicate file names will be handled in the target document library.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: New Version – Creates a new Version for the uploaded document. If Versioning is disabled in the document library, the existing document will be overwritten.

seg-source.mrk: New Version – Creates a new Version for the uploaded document.
If Versioning is disabled in the document library, the existing document will be overwritten.

trans-unit.source: Add Timestamp on File Name – Appends a timestamp at the end of the new file’s name and before the extension: <Year>-<Month>-<Day> - <Hour>-<Minute>-<Second>, for example Bicycle_Image 2014-04-03 11-23-54.bmp.

seg-source.mrk: Add Timestamp on File Name – Appends a timestamp at the end of the new file’s name and before the extension: <Year>-<Month>-<Day> - <Hour>-<Minute>-<Second>, for example Bicycle_Image 2014-04-03 11-23-54.bmp.

trans-unit.source: Report Upload Type

seg-source.mrk: Report Upload Type

trans-unit.source: Indicates additional actions when uploading a report via automated “Upload PDF” or “Post and Upload PDF” functions.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates additional actions when uploading a report via automated “Upload PDF” or “Post and Upload PDF” functions.

trans-unit.source: Only Upload – The report will be uploaded into SharePoint without any further action.

seg-source.mrk: Only Upload – The report will be uploaded into SharePoint without any further action.

trans-unit.source: Upload and Open – After uploading the report, the local copy (from a temporary path) will be opened, e.g. to manually print it.

seg-source.mrk: Upload and Open – After uploading the report, the local copy (from a temporary path) will be opened, e.g. to manually print it.

trans-unit.source: Upload and E-Mail – A new Email will be created by the default application with the PDF automatically attached.

seg-source.mrk: Upload and E-Mail – A new Email will be created by the default application with the PDF automatically attached.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Report Upload.htm#_Ref425178517" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Report Upload” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Report Upload.htm#_Ref425178517" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Report Upload” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Report File Name Formula

seg-source.mrk: Report File Name Formula

trans-unit.source: Defines the formula to generate the file name when automatically uploading a report. Possible variables are [RECORDID], [REPORT.ID], [REPORT.NAME], [REPORT.CAPTION], [TODAY], [TIME], [COMPANY] and [USERID]. An example for a formula would be “[RECORDID] - [REPORT.ID].pdf”.

seg-source.mrk: Defines the formula to generate the file name when automatically uploading a report.
Possible variables are [RECORDID], [REPORT.ID], [REPORT.NAME], [REPORT.CAPTION], [TODAY], [TIME], [COMPANY] and [USERID].
An example for a formula would be “[RECORDID] - [REPORT.ID].pdf”.

trans-unit.source: Service Timeout

seg-source.mrk: Service Timeout

trans-unit.source: Determines the timeout in milliseconds until the service aborts an action (such as retrieve document list for DocumentBox). “0” will use the default settings.

seg-source.mrk: Determines the timeout in milliseconds until the service aborts an action (such as retrieve document list for DocumentBox).
“0” will use the default settings.

trans-unit.source: Save Xml Nodes (Debug)

seg-source.mrk: Save Xml Nodes (Debug)

trans-unit.source: If selected, the XML files are saved for processing in the corresponding document entry fields. This field should only be activated for Debugging purposes.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the XML files are saved for processing in the corresponding document entry fields.
This field should only be activated for Debugging purposes.

trans-unit.source: Document Box FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Document Box FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on the Document Box FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Document Box FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Document Box Height

seg-source.mrk: Document Box Height

trans-unit.source: Sets the height of the DocumentBox. The user cannot resize the height on each page. Therefore, it should be configured to a suitable value for all display resolutions and number of document libraries.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the height of the DocumentBox.
The user cannot resize the height on each page.
Therefore, it should be configured to a suitable value for all display resolutions and number of document libraries.

trans-unit.source: Document Box Sorting

seg-source.mrk: Document Box Sorting

trans-unit.source: Sorts the order of documents in the DocumentBox, either ascending or descending, for the creation date or file name.

seg-source.mrk: Sorts the order of documents in the DocumentBox, either ascending or descending, for the creation date or file name.

trans-unit.source: Doc.-Box Layout

seg-source.mrk: Doc.-Box Layout

trans-unit.source: Defines the layout of the DocumentBox. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Defines the layout of the DocumentBox.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Logo and TreeView – Shows the Logo on the top section of the DocumentBox and the document list below.

seg-source.mrk: Logo and TreeView – Shows the Logo on the top section of the DocumentBox and the document list below.

trans-unit.source: TreeView Only – Displays only the document list, without the logo. This option is useful for a narrow implementation.

seg-source.mrk: TreeView Only – Displays only the document list, without the logo.
This option is useful for a narrow implementation.

trans-unit.source: Document Box Bitmap

seg-source.mrk: Document Box Bitmap

trans-unit.source: Stores the picture to be displayed on the top section of the DocumentBox. Uses standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV picture insertion functionality.

seg-source.mrk: Stores the picture to be displayed on the top section of the DocumentBox.
Uses standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV picture insertion functionality.

trans-unit.source: For an optimized performance, the picture size should not be more than 200 kb.

seg-source.mrk: For an optimized performance, the picture size should not be more than 200 kb.

trans-unit.source: History FastTab

seg-source.mrk: History FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on the History FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the History FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Save Document Entries

seg-source.mrk: Save Document Entries

trans-unit.source: If selected, document entries will not be deleted after successful processing. This enables a tracking of document actions from Microsoft Dynamics NAV. Tracked actions can be upload, delete and modify.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, document entries will not be deleted after successful processing.
This enables a tracking of document actions from Microsoft Dynamics NAV.
Tracked actions can be upload, delete and modify.

trans-unit.source: Remove Documents from Doc. Entries

seg-source.mrk: Remove Documents from Doc.
Entries

trans-unit.source: Determines if the document (binary, BLOB) is saved for each upload in the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database.

seg-source.mrk: Determines if the document (binary, BLOB) is saved for each upload in the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database.

trans-unit.source: If selected, the needed database volume increases with the saved document.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the needed database volume increases with the saved document.

trans-unit.source: If not selected, the document BLOB is removed after successful upload.

seg-source.mrk: If not selected, the document BLOB is removed after successful upload.

trans-unit.source: Navision Application Server FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Navision Application Server FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on the Navision Application Server FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Navision Application Server FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Protocol Entry Delete Formula

seg-source.mrk: Protocol Entry Delete Formula

trans-unit.source: Defines a formula to delete the protocol entries, created by NAS, which are older than the calculated formula compared to the current date.

seg-source.mrk: Defines a formula to delete the protocol entries, created by NAS, which are older than the calculated formula compared to the current date.

trans-unit.source: Document Entry Delete Formula

seg-source.mrk: Document Entry Delete Formula

trans-unit.source: Defines a formula to delete the document entries, created by Upload Type = Queue, which are older than the calculated formula compared to the current date.

seg-source.mrk: Defines a formula to delete the document entries, created by Upload Type = Queue, which are older than the calculated formula compared to the current date.

trans-unit.source: A running NAS for cc|dms is necessary to perform this auto delete.

seg-source.mrk: A running NAS for cc|dms is necessary to perform this auto delete.

trans-unit.source: NAS Poll Interval (Milliseconds)

seg-source.mrk: NAS Poll Interval (Milliseconds)

trans-unit.source: Sets a time interval between the end of the previous and the start of the next NAS processing. A high interval results in longer breaks between the definition and the processed action (upload, modify, delete) of a document, if Upload Type = Queue.

seg-source.mrk: Sets a time interval between the end of the previous and the start of the next NAS processing.
A high interval results in longer breaks between the definition and the processed action (upload, modify, delete) of a document, if Upload Type = Queue.

trans-unit.source: Log Document Entry Heartbeat

seg-source.mrk: Log Document Entry Heartbeat

trans-unit.source: If selected, a heartbeat protocol entry will be created after each poll interval to check the vital sign of the NAS.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, a heartbeat protocol entry will be created after each poll interval to check the vital sign of the NAS.

trans-unit.source: Product Version Information

seg-source.mrk: Product Version Information

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click About to display the current product version information.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click About to display the current product version information.

trans-unit.source: : Product version information accessed by clicking About on the ribbon

seg-source.mrk: : Product version information accessed by clicking About on the ribbon

trans-unit.source: Actions Tab

seg-source.mrk: Actions Tab

trans-unit.source: The Actions tab includes two items that are relevant to table setup in cc|dms. Both are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The Actions tab includes two items that are relevant to table setup in cc|dms.
Both are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Action

seg-source.mrk: Action

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Release All

seg-source.mrk: Release All

trans-unit.source: Releases all Table Setups in the system.

seg-source.mrk: Releases all Table Setups in the system.

trans-unit.source: Reopen All

seg-source.mrk: Reopen All

trans-unit.source: Opens all released Table Setups in the system.

seg-source.mrk: Opens all released Table Setups in the system.

seg-source.mrk: Navigate Tab

trans-unit.source: The Navigate tab includes items that are relevant to report selections and user rights in cc|dms.

seg-source.mrk: The Navigate tab includes items that are relevant to report selections and user rights in cc|dms.

trans-unit.source: : Actions on the Navigate tab in DMS Setup

seg-source.mrk: : Actions on the Navigate tab in DMS Setup

trans-unit.source: Each is described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: Each is described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Action

seg-source.mrk: Action

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Report Selection - Sales / Report Selection - Purchase / Report Selection - Service

seg-source.mrk: Report Selection - Sales / Report Selection - Purchase / Report Selection - Service

trans-unit.source: Opens the report selections for sales, purchase and service; also includes fields for configuring the document library and content type to upload the PDF to SharePoint.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the report selections for sales, purchase and service; also includes fields for configuring the document library and content type to upload the PDF to SharePoint.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Report Upload.htm#_Ref425188328" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Report Upload” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: User Credentials

seg-source.mrk: User Credentials

trans-unit.source: Opens the DMS User Credentials page, where users without access to uploading files in SharePoint can be assigned a “SharePoint User Account” that can upload files. Without any configuration, the Microsoft Dynamics NAV user account communicates with SharePoint.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the DMS User Credentials page, where users without access to uploading files in SharePoint can be assigned a “SharePoint User Account” that can upload files.
Without any configuration, the Microsoft Dynamics NAV user account communicates with SharePoint.

trans-unit.source: Settings here affect all Document Libraries, while settings on the Document Libraries affect only those libraries.

seg-source.mrk: Settings here affect all Document Libraries, while settings on the Document Libraries affect only those libraries.

trans-unit.source: A global function in the DMS - Management codeunit verifies the “global” User ID entries (entered here) and the User ID entries for a special document library. This function also allows for the usage of a “default user” by entering an asterisk (*) in the User ID (NAV) field.

seg-source.mrk: A global function in the DMS - Management codeunit verifies the “global” User ID entries (entered here) and the User ID entries for a special document library.
This function also allows for the usage of a “default user” by entering an asterisk (*) in the User ID (NAV) field.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the user credentials set here are used for service adapter pattern queries, which allows the service adapter pattern to run for SharePoint Online. For information about the Service Adapter Pattern, refer to the “cc|dms 2015 SP1 - LibrarySet User Manual” documentation.

seg-source.mrk: Additionally, the user credentials set here are used for service adapter pattern queries, which allows the service adapter pattern to run for SharePoint Online.
For information about the Service Adapter Pattern, refer to the “cc|dms 2015 SP1 - LibrarySet User Manual” documentation.
